Incoming! Important Dates for Finals, Holidays and Commencement




					By Jenny Steinbeck				

on
March 27, 2023


in
Alumni, Community, CSUN Events, Graduation Ceremony, students, University News 

Comments Off on Incoming! Important Dates for Finals, Holidays and Commencement 








Graduation 2022. Photo by David J. Hawkins. 











Is it just us, or does the semester seem to speed up after Spring Break? Keep calm and finish strong, Matadors! CSUN Today is here to help you keep track of important dates — for students and graduates alike.
For all CSUN students, the Student Academic Calendar is always helpful.
March 20-26: Spring Recess (aka Spring Break)
March 31: Cesar Chavez Day. Campus is closed for the state holiday. 
May 12: Last day of formal instruction. 
May 13-19: Final Exams.
May 25: Last day of academic year.
May 29: Memorial Day holiday. Campus is closed.
May 30: Summer classes for sessions 1 and 2 begin.
For Graduating Seniors, the CSUN Commencement and document deadline pages are key resources. Here are some important dates for graduates:
Commencement Ticket Information 
March 1-April 14: Download and/or email your Commencement tickets for loved ones (tickets are free of charge but limited). 
Cap and Gown Information (Information from Herff Jones, Graduation Suppliers) 
Cap/Gown Rental home shipped in 10-15 days for $16.95. 
April 16: Cap/Gown Rental home shipping fee increases to $24.95.
April 30: Cap/Gown Rental Home Shipping closes.
May 8: Pre-Ordered Cap/Gown Pick-up at CSUN Campus Store. 
May 9: Walk-in Cap/Gown Rental Opens at CSUN Campus Store 
May 13: Honors Convocation, 6 p.m., Library Lawn. Tickets required. 
July 28: Last day to submit documents and confirm awarding of bachelor’s degrees for Spring 2023. 
May 19-25: Commencement Ceremonies 
The commencement ceremonies page includes dates and times of commencement ceremonies by college, as well as numerous cultural celebrations, such as Black Graduation, Rainbow Graduation and hooding ceremonies for master’s and doctoral graduates. 
Friday, May 19 6:00 p.m.
College of Engineering and Computer Science
College of Science and Mathematics 
Saturday, May 20 8:00 a.m.
College of Social and Behavioral Sciences I
(Africana Studies, Anthropology, Criminology and Justice Studies, Geography, History, Sociology, Urban Studies/Planning) 
Saturday, May 20 6:00 p.m.
Michael D. Eisner College of Education
College of Social and Behavioral Sciences II
(Political Science, Public Administration, Public Sector Management, Psychology, Social Work)
Sunday, May 21 8:00 a.m.
College of Humanities 
College of Health and Human Development I 
(Communication Disorders, Family and Consumer Sciences, Kinesiology) 
Sunday, May 21 6:00 p.m.
College of Health and Human Development II
(Assisted Tech Studies, Child and Adolescent Development, Environmental and Occupational Health, Health Sciences, Nursing, Physical Therapy, and Recreation and Tourism Management)
Monday, May 22 8:00 a.m.
David Nazarian College of Business & Economics
Monday, May 22 6:00 p.m.
Mike Curb College of Arts, Media, and Communication
